subject: Public Speaking
title: Moral Outrage as a Call to Action
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Moral Outrage as a Call to Action.

hook.text: How dare you! Greta Thunberg's outrage wasn't just emotion â€” it was a calculated call to action through anger.

buildup.text: Moral outrage works because it triggers a sense of injustice. People don't just feel bad â€” they feel compelled to act.

discovery.text: Research shows outrage activates the same neural pathways as personal threat. The audience feels attacked, not informed.

twist.text: Sustained outrage leads to fatigue. If every speech is angry, audiences go numb. Outrage is a tool, not a personality.

climax.text: The best outrage is specific, justified, and followed by a concrete demand. Unfocused anger just exhausts people.

punchline.text: Anger moves people. But only if you tell them where to go.

quiz.question: When does moral outrage work as persuasion?
options: When it's specific, justified, and followed by a demand
